text: John T. Satriale (July 13, 1919 – November 2017) was an American lawyer and politician from New York. ==Life== He was born on July 13, 1919, in New York City,New York Red Book (1949; pg. 217) the son of Gaudioso Satriale (1884–1968). He attended Public School No. 6, and DeWitt Clinton High School. He graduated from Fordham College, and LL.B. from Brooklyn Law School.New York Red Book (1961–1962; pg. 208) Satriale was a member of the New York State Assembly from 1949 to 1965, sitting in the 167th, 168th, 169th, 170th, 171st, 172nd, 173rd, 174th and 175th New York State Legislatures. He was Chairman of the Committee on Ways and Means in 1965. In September 1965, after re- apportionment, he ran in the 89th District for re-nomination, but was defeated in the Democratic primary by Robert Abrams. He died in November 2017 at the age of 98.John Satriale Obituary ==Sources== Category:1919 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Brooklyn Law School alumni Category:DeWitt Clinton High School alumni Category:Fordham University alumni Category:People from the Bronx Category:Members of the New York State Assembly Category:New York (state) Democrats Category:Politicians from the Bronx
